medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever, pain, and cranial-nerve deficits after treatment for squamous-cell cancer of the oral cavity.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed a painful ulcer on the right side of the floor of the mouth approximately 9 months before admission. Pain around the right eye and forehead, along with ptosis and diplopia, developed four days after the completion of radiotherapy. Symptoms worsened over the next several days, leading to complete right ophthalmoplegia and increased pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of squamous-cell carcinoma of the oral cavity, depression, and alcoholism; smoked cigarettes (70 pack-years) but stopped smoking after the diagnosis of oral cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Spent time in halfway houses; stopped drinking alcohol 3 months prior to admission; no illicit drug use.
